TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi sealed beforefieldinit AlternateMailbox extends System.Object

Docs.summary: Contains information about an alternate to one of a user's mailboxes; for example, an archive of a user's inbox.

MemberSignature.Value: public string DisplayName { get; }
.property instance string DisplayName
Public ReadOnly Property DisplayName As String
public: property System::String ^ DisplayName { System::String ^ get(); };

Docs.summary: Gets the name of the alternate mailbox that is displayed to a user.
Docs.value: The display name of the alternate mailbox.

MemberSignature.Value: public string LegacyDN { get; }
.property instance string LegacyDN
Public ReadOnly Property LegacyDN As String
public: property System::String ^ LegacyDN { System::String ^ get(); };

Docs.summary: Gets the legacy domain name of the alternate mailbox.
Docs.value: The legacy domain name of the alternate mailbox.

MemberSignature.Value: public string OwnerSmtpAddress { get; }
.property instance string OwnerSmtpAddress
Public ReadOnly Property OwnerSmtpAddress As String
public: property System::String ^ OwnerSmtpAddress { System::String ^ get(); };

Docs.summary: Gets the SMTP address of the alternate mailbox's owner.The property is applicable for clients that target Exchange Online and versions of Exchange starting with 15.00.0847.032.

MemberSignature.Value: public string Server { get; }
.property instance string Server
Public ReadOnly Property Server As String
public: property System::String ^ Server { System::String ^ get(); };

Docs.summary: Gets the name of the server hosting the alternate mailbox.
Docs.value: The name of the alternate mailbox server.

MemberSignature.Value: public string SmtpAddress { get; }
.property instance string SmtpAddress
Public ReadOnly Property SmtpAddress As String
public: property System::String ^ SmtpAddress { System::String ^ get(); };

Docs.summary: Gets the alternate mailbox Simple Mail Transfer Protocol (SMTP) address if the and properties are a null reference (Nothing in Visual Basic).The property is applicable for clients that target Exchange Online and versions of Exchange starting with Exchange Server 2013.
Docs.value: The alternate mailbox SMTP address if the and properties are a null reference (Nothing in Visual Basic). Otherwise, a null reference (Nothing in Visual Basic).

MemberSignature.Value: public string Type { get; }
.property instance string Type
Public ReadOnly Property Type As String
public: property System::String ^ Type { System::String ^ get(); };

Docs.summary: Gets the type of the alternate mailbox; for example, archive.
Docs.value: The type of the alternate mailbox.
